Your Career Compass

Reduce uncertainty with a simple, data‑driven process: take two or more assessments, cross‑reference themes, then use the Decision Matrix to choose your best‑fit options.

Step 1 — The Tools

Truity Holland Code (RIASEC)

Scientifically‑grounded model (RIASEC) that maps interests to work environments. ~10–15 minutes. [1]

O*NET Interest Profiler

U.S. Dept of Labor profiler with deep occupation database and job outlook links. [2]

FundiConnect Career Quiz

South Africa‑focused quiz linking suggestions to local study options and bursaries. [3]

DHET Khetha / Career Help

SA context: guidance, understanding results, and planning next steps. [4]

CAO Self‑assessment Quiz

Quick working‑personality and interest snapshot for SA applicants. [5]

123test (RIASEC)

Independent RIASEC test to triangulate your interests and strengths. [6]

Alison Aptitude Test

Free aptitude screening to complement interest‑based results. [7]

Step 2 — The Method

Information

Cross‑reference for recurring themes

  1. Complete 2–3 assessments and save the results (PDF or screenshots).
  2. List the top careers and skills each test mentions (5–10 items each).
  3. Highlight overlaps: repeated fields, common skills, typical work environments.
  4. Check realistic entry requirements (APS, subject minimums) for each option.
  5. Move your 3–5 strongest options into the Decision Matrix and score them.

Step 3 — Build Your Decision Matrix

Add careers, rate Interest, Skills Match, and Job Demand (1–5). The total updates automatically. Sort, export, or import your data anytime.

Career Decision Matrix

Career OptionInterest (1-5)Skills Match (1-5)Job Demand (1-5)QualificationFundingTotalRemove
